bibl.title: On Herodotus (II, 72), and the Question of the Existence of the Otter (Lutra sp.) in Ancient Egypt.
bibl.note: Herodotus was mistaken about the existence of otters in ancient Egypt, much in the same way he was in error when he stated (II, 67) that bears (Ursus sp.) occurred there as well.
bibl.seg: HOULIHAN Patrick Francis, On Herodotus (II, 72), and the Question of the Existence of the Otter (Lutra sp.) in Ancient Egypt.
Herodotus was mistaken about the existence of otters in ancient Egypt, much in the same way he was in error when he stated (II, 67) that bears (Ursus sp.) occurred there as well.
